columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database. This is the primary key for this table. The last 5 characters will be same as the CPRD practice identifier

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: usualgpstaffid
columns.description: The GP that the patient is nominally registered with. To be used with the Staff table for reference

columns.name: gender
columns.description: Patient’s gender

columns.name: yob
columns.description: Patient’s year of birth. This is actual year of birth e.g. 1984.

columns.name: mob
columns.description: Patient’s month of birth (for those aged under 16).

columns.name: emis_ddate
columns.description: Date of death as recorded in the EMIS® software. Researchers are advised to treat the emis_ddate with caution and consider using the cprd_ddate variable below.

columns.name: regstartdate
columns.description: The date that the patient registered with the CPRD contributing practice. Most recent date the patient is recorded as having registered at the practice. If a patient deregistered for a period of time and returned, the return date would be recorded.

columns.name: patienttypeid
columns.description: The category that the patient has been assigned to e.g. private, regular, temporary.

columns.name: regenddate
columns.description: Date the patient's registration at the practice ended. This may represent a transfer-out date or death date.

columns.name: acceptable
columns.description: Flag to indicate whether the patient has met certain quality standards: 1 =acceptable, 0 = unacceptable

columns.name: cprd_ddate
columns.description: Estimated date of death of patient – derived using a CPRD algorithm

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: lcd
columns.description: Date of the most recent CPRD data collection for the practice.

columns.name: uts
columns.description: The date at which the practice data is deemed to be of research quality, based on CPRD algorithm. [Not currently populated]

columns.name: region
columns.description: Value to indicate where in the UK the practice is based. The region denotes the Strategic Health Authority (for builds to Dec 2021) or ONS region (for builds from Jan 2022) for English practices.

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member in CPRD Aurum. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: jobcatid
columns.description: Job category of the staff member who created the event

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database.

columns.name: consid
columns.description: Unique identifier given to the consultation. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: consdate
columns.description: Date associated with the event

columns.name: enterdate
columns.description: Date the event was entered into the practice system

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member who took the consultation in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: conssourceid
columns.description: Identifier that allows retrieval of anonymised information on the source or location of the consultation as recorded in the EMIS® software. Only the most frequently occurring strings have been anonymised and are included in the lookup. All others have been withheld by CPRD, pending anonymisation where feasible.

columns.name: cprdconstype
columns.description: Type of consultation: this will be generated by CPRD based on information recorded in the consmedcodeid and conssourceid variables. [Not currently populated]
columns.mapping: Lookup: cprdconstype.txt [not included in initial release]

columns.name: consmedcodeid
columns.description: Source of the consultation from EMIS® software. This is a medical code that can be used with the medical dictionary. It may contain information similar to the consultation source identifiers but is available for use now. Some of the codes may not be interpretable e.g. Awaiting clinical code migration to EMIS Web®.

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database.

columns.name: consid
columns.description: Linked consultation identifier. In EMIS Web® it is not necessary to enter observations within a consultation, so this identifier may be missing.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: obsid
columns.description: Unique identifier given to the observation. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: obsdate
columns.description: Date associated with the event

columns.name: enterdate
columns.description: Date the event was entered into EMIS Web®

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member who took the consultation in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: parentobsid
columns.description: Observation identifier (obsid) that is the parent to the observation. This enables grouping of multiple observations, such as systolic and diastolic blood pressure, or blood test results.

columns.name: medcodeid
columns.description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP

columns.name: value
columns.description: Measurement or test value

columns.name: numunitid
columns.description: Unit of measurement

columns.name: obstypeid
columns.description: Type of observation (allergy, family history, observation)

columns.name: numrangelow
columns.description: Value representing the low boundary of the normal range for this measurement

columns.name: numrangehigh
columns.description: Value representing the high boundary of the normal range for this measurement

columns.name: probobsid
columns.description:
Observation identifier (obsid) of any problem that an observation is associated with. An example of this might be an overarching condition that the current observation is associated with such as ‘wheezing’ with the problem observation identifier that links to an observation of ‘asthma’, that in turn contains information in the
problem table.

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database.

columns.name: obsid
columns.description: Unique identifier given to the observation. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: refsourceorgid
columns.description: Source organisation of the referral. Organisations are identified by an ID number and each organisation has a type (e.g. hospital inpatient department, community clinic). Both the organisation table and the OrgType lookup are required. The lookups are undergoing anonymisation work. [Not currently populated]
columns.mapping: Lookups: Organisation.txt [not included in initial release] and OrgType.txt

columns.name: reftargetorgid
columns.description: Source organisation of the referral. Organisations are identified by an ID number and each organisation has a type (e.g. hospital inpatient department, community clinic). Both the organisation table and the OrgType lookup are required. The lookups are undergoing anonymisation work. [Not currently populated]
columns.mapping: Lookups: Organisation.txt [not included in initial release] and OrgType.txt

columns.name: refurgencyid
columns.description: Urgency of the referral e.g. routine, urgent, dated

columns.name: refservicetypeid
columns.description: Type of service the referral relates to e.g. assessment, management, investigation

columns.name: refmodeid
columns.description: Mode by which the referral was made e.g. telephone, written

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database.

columns.name: obsid
columns.description: Unique identifier given to the observation. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: parentprobobsid
columns.description: Observation identifier for the parent observation of the problem. This can be used to group problems via the Observation table.

columns.name: probenddate
columns.description: Date the problem ended

columns.name: expduration
columns.description: Expected duration of the problem in days

columns.name: lastrevdate
columns.description: Date the problem was last reviewed

columns.name: lastrevstaffid
columns.description: Staff member who last reviewed the problem

columns.name: parentprobrelid
columns.description: Description of the relationship of the problem to another problem e.g. the problem may have evolved or been merged with another problem as the problem, or the GP’s understanding of the problem, changes

columns.name: probstatusid
columns.description: Status of the problem (active, past)

columns.name: signid
columns.description: Significance of the problem (minor, significant)

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD Aurum. The patient identifier is unique to CPRD Aurum and may represent a different patient in the CPRD GOLD database.

columns.name: issueid
columns.description: Unique identifier given to the issue record. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a practice in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: probobsid
columns.description: Unique identifier for the observation that links to a problem under which this prescription was issued. This refers to an ‘obsid’ in the Observation table which, in turn, can be linked to a record in the Problem table using ‘obsid’.

columns.name: drugrecid
columns.description: Unique identifier to a drug template record, which is not currently for release. At present this may be used to group repeat prescriptions from the same template.

columns.name: issuedate
columns.description: Date associated with the event

columns.name: enterdate
columns.description: Date the event was entered into EMIS Web®

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member issued the treatment in CPRD Aurum

columns.name: prodcodeid
columns.description: Unique CPRD code for the treatment selected by the GP

columns.name: dosageid
columns.description: Identifier that allows dosage information on the event to be retrieved. Not included in first release

columns.name: quantity
columns.description: Total quantity entered by the GP for the prescribed treatment

columns.name: quantunitid
columns.description: Unit of the treatment (capsule, tablet)

columns.name: duration
columns.description: Duration of the treatment in days

columns.name: estnhscost
columns.description: Estimated cost of the treatment to the NHS

columns.name: prodcodeid
columns.description: CPRD code to describe the treatment. Links to the Drug Issue table. This is the primary key for this table.

columns.name: dmdid
columns.description: The DM+D code associated with the treatment

columns.name: termfromemis
columns.description: Description of the treatment provided by EMIS® associated with the prodcodeid

columns.name: productname
columns.description: Name of the product

columns.name: formulation
columns.description: Formulation of the product

columns.name: routeofadministration
columns.description: Route of administration for the product

columns.name: drugsubstancename
columns.description: Active ingredient(s) included in the product. For combination therapies, each component is listed, separated by /

columns.name: substancestrength
columns.description: Strength of each active ingredient listed in the drugsubstancename column, including units. Separated by / if more than 1

columns.name: bnfchapter
columns.description: BNF chapter to which the product belongs

columns.name: release
columns.description: Reference data version. [Not currently populated]
